abstract.description:
PFNanoProducerTool is a CMSSW producer module that allows users to add Particle Flow (PF) candidates to NanoAOD files, by preprocessing MiniAOD files. The example input in the code is for 2016 MiniAOD files.

This code has been used to produce NanoAOD-PF files that are available from this portal.

system_details.description: Use this software in the CMS Open Data VM environment (CMS VM Image for 2016-2018 CMS open data) or in the corresponding Docker container.

usage.description:
PFNanoProducerTool is an producer package to be used with the CMSSW software. CMSSW is available in the CMS Open Data environments: in the CMS Docker container and in the CMS VM image:

  • For the Docker container, install the corresponding Docker container.
  • For the VM image, follow the instructions in How to install a CERN Virtual Machine.

To download and run the PFNanoProducer code, follow the instructions at https://github.com/cms-opendata-analyses/PFNanoProducerTool.

For more information about physics object access, see the CMS Open Data Guide web site.

The output files from the PFNanoProducer package have the usual NanoAOD content and, in addition, the PF candidate information. The files are produced in the ROOT format and their analysis does not require the use of CMSSW and CMS Open data environments.

use_with.description: Use this software with any CMS 2016 MiniAOD or MiniAODSIM datasets.
